result.execSummary:
The defendant Auntrae Boyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Pay DNA surcharge, costs, assessments and surcharges. To be paid by 3/31/14 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

The first five days, straight time.  Balance can be served with huber for Day Reporting  Program. No objection to electronic monitoring while in the program.
If defendant is in the Day Reporting Program, he can be released to attend the birth of his child, but must be back in custody the next day.
Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Auntrae Boyd

records.addlTxt: Bond posted on 17CF4054 applied to the following case with outstanding debt:  14CF279 for $523.00 18TR17638 for $204.00

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Auntrae Boyd in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.

Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample, and pay the DNA surcharge, if not previously done, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 8 months at the House of Correction - the first 5 days - straight time - the ballance can be served with Huber for Day Report Program - no objection to electronic monitoring while in the program and 3 days credit; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by 3-31-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

If the defendant is in the Day Reporting Program, he can be released to attend the firth of his child, but must be back in custody the next day. 

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Auntrae Boyd in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Auntrae Boyd
Current: 5120 West Center Street, #1, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 03-06-2014)
Prior: 2913 North 4th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53202
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Auntrae Boyd in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated February 3, 2014, received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. 
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.

Defendant Auntrae Boyd in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Defendant Auntrae Boyd in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Auntrae Boyd
Current: 2913 North 4th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53202   (Effective: 01-22-2014)
Prior: 2913 North 4th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
